course_title: Topics in Jewish Literature: The New Jew
class_notes: (Same as MESAS 270W 1) The New Jew is a transformed historical figure, the antithesis of pre-Enlightenment European Jew, who was confined to Pales, ghettoes, and cohesive communities, bound to the House of Study (conviction and practices), and deprived of participation in histories and cultures. This course is a survey of this mythological European-American-Jewish Palestinian and Israeli figure since its inception in Modern Hebrew Literature.
course_description: Special Topics in Jewish Literature: Variety of subjects emphasizing Jewish Literature. Content will vary. May be repeated when the topic changes.
sections: Class Nbr: 2538, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: O. Yeglin, Status: Open
